articles.title: Letter to Kim Jong Il from foreign diplomatic corps
articles.content:
Letter to Kim Jong Il from foreign diplomatic corps 
    Pyongyang, April 14 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a congratulatory letter from the foreign diplomatic corps in Korea on the occasion of Sun's Day.   Palestinian ambassador Shahir Mohammed Abdlah,  on behalf of the corps, handed it to Paek Nam Sun,  Minister of Foreign Affairs, on Apr. 13.

articles.title: Loyalty to Kim Il Sung pledged
Large flower baskets to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Large flower baskets to Kim Jong Il
    Pyongyang, April 14 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with large floral baskets by president of the Senate of Cambodia and chairman of the central committee of the People's Party of Cambodia Chea Sim and speaker of the parliament Norodom Ranariddh respectively in the countdown to Sun's Day.    The  baskets were conveyed to the DPRK ambassador to Cambodia.

articles.title: KCNA on Japanese Foreign Minister's remarks
Branch of Italian Juche Idea Study Committee formed
articles.content:
Branch of Italian Juche Idea Study Committee formed
   Pyongyang, April 14 (KCNA) -- The Catania branch of the Italian Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea was formed on April 9 on the occasion of the birthday of the President Kim Il Sung.   At the inaugural meeting, the reporter and speakers referred to the creation of the Juche idea, its historic signification and philosophical principle and said that General Secretary Kim Jong Il has developed and enriched the Juche idea and wisely led the revolution and construction.

articles.title: Preparatory committees inaugurated in Tajikistan
articles.content:
Preparatory committees inaugurated in Tajikistan
    Pyongyang, April 14 (KCNA) -- The standing committee of the c.c., the Communist Party of Tajikistan on March 30 issued a resolution no. 35 on inaugurating a preparatory committee to commemorate Sun's Day on the occasion of the 87th birth anniversary of the President Kim Il Sung.   The resolution said that the c.c., the Communist Party of Tajikistan inaugurates a preparatory committee to commemorate the 87th birth anniversary of Kim Il Sung, President of the DPRK, on the occasion of Sun's Day.   It pointed to commemoration programs to be carried out in April.   The Tajikistan Foreign Friendship and Cultural Liaison Council also formed a preparatory committee on April 5 to commemorate Sun's Day.

articles.title: Jang Chol meets cultural  delegation and dance troupe
articles.content:
Jang Chol meets cultural  delegation and dance troupe
   Pyongyang, April 14 (KCNA) -- Chairman Jang Chol of the organizing committee of the 17th April Spring Friendship Art Festival had a talk with the Cambodian government cultural delegation headed by Sisowath Sirivuth Panara, secretary of State of the Ministry of Culture and Art, at Mansudae Assembly Hall on April 13.   The head of the delegation said that the intimate friendship between the President Kim Il Sung and King Norodom Sihanouk is inherited through generations and the friendly relationship between Cambodia and the DPRK will be everlasting under the guidance of the great Marshal Kim Jong Il.   He sincerely wished that the Korean people would live happily in a reunified country under the leadership of Kim Jong Il.   That day Jang Chol had a talk with the Russian Beryozka Dance Troupe at the Pyongyang International House of Culture.

articles.title: Film show held
articles.content:
Film show held
    Pyongyang, April 14 (KCNA) -- The Ministry of the People's Armed Forces gave a film show at the People's Palace of Culture on April 13 on the occasion of Sun's Day.   Present on invitation were the members of the foreign military attaches corps here.   General jong Chang Ryol and other generals and officers of the Korean People's Army were among those present.   The participants appreciated a documentary film showing the President Kim Il Sung mixing with KPA officers and men and showing warm loving care for them.

articles.title: Cambodian delegations visit Korean embassy
Cuban embassy officials visit Kim Il Sung's statue
articles.content:
Cuban embassy officials visit Kim Il Sung's statue
   Pyongyang, April 14 (KCNA) -- Cuban ambassador to Korea Jose Manuel Inclan Embade and embassy officials on Tuesday laid a floral basket before the statue of the President Kim Il Sung on Mansu Hill on the occasion of Sun's Day.   They also planted 39 magnolia trees in the arboretum of the sacred Temple of Juche, the Kumsusan Memorial Palace,ï¿½@where the president lies in state  as a token of a long-standing history of friendship between the two countries.   The ambassador said the friendship between the two countries forged by Kim Il Sung and Fidel Castro Ruz will be everlasting.   Meanwhile, they visited the Korean Revolution Museum.

articles.title: S. Korean authorities keen on joining "Hawaii dispatch drill"
articles.content:
S. Korean authorities keen on joining "Hawaii dispatch drill" 
    Pyongyang, April 14 (KCNA) -- The South Korean authorities announced that they would send a submarine of the navy on April 14 to a war exercise dubbed Hawaii dispatch drill involving the U.S., Australia and other countries, a South Korean newspaper report said.   In the war game they will practice command and communications of the submarine and increase its tactical and operational capabilities through air-to-sub warfare and anti-surface vessel attack exercises, they said.   The projected dispatch is clear evidence of their frantic war preparations.

articles.title: "First half of 1999 Ssangryong" drill projected in S. Korea
articles.content:
"First half of 1999 Ssangryong" drill projected in S. Korea
     Pyongyang, April 14 (KCNA) -- The South Korean authorities announced that there would be what they call "first half of 1999 Ssangryong" from April 13 through 16, a Seoul-based radio said.   They plan to call vehicles out to the war exercise in inland, central and western areas of north Chungchong Province.

articles.title: Foreigners visit various places
articles.content:
Foreigners visit various places
   Pyongyang, April 14 (KCNA) -- The diplomatic corps here visited the first Kimilsungia show on April 13 with Sun's Day just at hand.   At the end of the visit, the guests made an entry in the visitors' book.  Lao ambassador to Korea Khamkheng Sayakeo said that beautiful Kimilsungia in full bloom are clear evidence of boundless reverence of the Korean people and the progressives of the world for the President Kim Il Sung. The visit  provided me with a good opportunity to keenly realize the great exploits and dignity of the President, he said.   On the same day the military attaches corps here visited the Pyongyang cultural exhibition.   On display are works of the President Kim Il Sung and Marshal Kim Jong Il, books and data on their ideo-theoretical exploits.    Also exhibited are art works and handiwork.

articles.title: Commemorations of Sun's Day go on
articles.content:
Commemorations of Sun's Day go on
   Pyongyang, April 14 (KCNA) -- Commemorations of Sun's Day, the birth anniversary of the great leader President Kim Il Sung, took place on April 13.   There were a public presentation of the greatness of the President by the Ministry of Public Security, an oratorical contest of youth and students from across the country, a national joint performance of art groups of workers, a loyal oath-taking meeting of members of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea and a national meeting of schoolchildren to hear stories about the childhood of the President Kim Il Sung.   Stressed at these functions were great revolutionary feats and noble virtues of President Kim Il Sung.

Spring festival goes on with swing
articles.content:
Spring festival goes on with swing
      Pyongyang, April 14 (KCNA) -- Art performances of the 17th April Spring Friendship Art Festival were given at theatres in Pyongyang on April 13.    The group performances of the festival which began in a grand style on April 11 came to a close.   Put on the stage were hundreds of numbers, including songs, dances, pieces of instrumental music and circus acts.      The art works reflect the unbounded reverence of all people for the President Kim Il Sung and unshakable faith and will of humankind to uphold and follow General Secretary Kim Jong Il as the sun of the 21st century.   Also put on the stage were foreign art works on traditional and national way of life.   A joint performance will be given in the wake of the group performances.

S. Korean authorities scheme to destroy Hanchongryon
articles.content:
S. Korean authorities scheme to destroy Hanchongryon
   Pyongyang, April 14 (KCNA) -- The South Korean prosecution on April 11 announced that it decided to block an extraordinary meeting of deputies to the 7th-term South Korean Federation of University Student Councils (Hanchongryon) at the "initial stage," according to a news report from South Korea.   Saying that it brought lawsuits against 161 students affiliated with the 6th-term Hanchongryon and declared them guilty at the first trial, it threatened it would continue to punish members of Hanchongryon on the strength of the "National Security Law."

Gift to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il
   Pyongyang, April 14 (KCNA) - General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a gift from the general secretary of the central committee of the Communist Party of Peru (Red Motherland).   The gift was handed to Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Worker's Party of Korea, by Alberto Moreno, general secretary of the c.c. of the party, on a visit to Korea.
